Title: Trump says will double steel, aluminum tariffs to 50%
Summary: US President Donald Trump says he will double steel and aluminum import tariffs to 50% from next week . Latest salvo in his trade wars aimed at protecting domestic industries . “We’re going to bring it from 25 percent to 50 percent," Trump says .

Title: Sani urges activists to defend democracy, hold govt accountable
Summary: Governor Uba Sani of Kaduna urges activists to defend democracy, hold govt accountable . According to him, activists are expected to live above board and serve the people .

Title: Gabon to ban export of raw manganese from 2029
Summary: Gabon will cease exporting manganese from 2029 as part of a plan to transform national industry . Selling manganes can be used in the production of stainless steel . President Brice Oligui Nguema said in a government statement .

Title: Niger flood: 3,018 displaced, 11 injured as death toll continues to rise
Summary: The death toll of Mokwa flood disaster has risen to 151 . 11 persons sustained various degrees of injuries, while 3,018 persons were displaced . The spokesperson of the agency, Hussaini Hussaini, said the death toll continues to rise .

Title: Hustle, stress, repeat: The silent mental health crisis at work
Summary: The Nigerian hustle has become an identity but at what cost? As long hours, unrealistic demands, and mental exhaustion become the norm, it's time to ask: what is the price of productivity in Nigeria’s corporate world?

Title: Nigeria, ECOWAS collaborate to fast-track Abidjan-Lagos highway
Summary: Nigeria and ECOWAS Parliament are working together to fast-track the Abidjan-Lagos highway project . The project is expected to create jobs, grow trade, and improve lives across West Africa .

Title: NAPTIP considers legal action as Speed Darlington snubs summon
Summary: The National Agency for the Prohibition of Trafficking in Persons (NAPTIP) is considering legal action against Nigerian entertainer Darlington Okoye . The entertainer failed to appear at its Abuja headquarters on Friday, May 30 .

Title: Play Station 2, four other biggest-selling gaming consoles
Summary: Hundreds of millions have been sold to players eager to immerse themselves in favourite franchises from "Assassin's Creed" to "Zelda" Nintendo Switch 2 due out on Thursday .

Title: Anti-Tinubu coalition: Neither ADC nor SDP can serve our purpose – Northern Democrats
Summary: League of Northern Democrats recommended that coalition register a new political party . …opt for new party . League is arm of National Opposition Coalition Group ahead of 2027 general elections .

Title: Benue Police Command gets DSP Edet as new PPRO
Summary: Deputy Superintendent of Police, DSP, Udeme Edet has been appointed the new Police Public Relations Officer, PPRO, Benue State Command by the Inspector-General of Police .

Title: Zamfara making progress in security, peace efforts -Gov
Summary: The Zamfara State Governor, Dauda Lawal, made the remarks during a “Walk for Peace” held to mark the second anniversary of his administration . Lawal said there has been significant improvement in the state, as his administration has invested heavily in security to ensure lasting peace .

Title: Nigeria's woes caused by attitudinal deficit – APC's Afegbua
Summary: A member of the All Progressives Congress, Kassim Afegbua, has declared that Nigeria’s challenges stem from an “attitudinal deficit” among its citizens, rather than a fundamental failure of the nation itself . He also took the opportunity to commend President Bola Tinubu for his “bold decision

Title: Niger flood: 151 dead, over 3,000 displaced - Govt
Summary: The number of corpses recovered so far from the flood that ravaged Niger State communities in Mokwa Local Government Area has risen to 151 . The Niger State Emergency Management Agency, made this known on Saturday morning in a terse statement in which it said three communities were affected and two bridges washed away .

Title: Bauchi to hire 2,000 teachers for public schools
Summary: Bauchi State Governor, Bala Mohammed, has approved the recruitment of over 2,000 teachers across public schools in the state . This was disclosed by the Executive Chairman of the Bauch State Basic Education Board, Adamu Duguri . Duguri described the construction of the model schools as a step towards improving basic education at the

Title: EFCC arrests 43 suspected internet fraudsters in Nasarawa
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has announced the arrest of 43 individuals suspected of engaging in internet-related fraud . The operation was carried out on Friday by the operatives in the Toto area of Nasarawa State . The arrests were made following credible and actionable intelligence which linked the suspects to a series of fraudulent activities conducted online .
